reviewText: Not to any standard of crime procedure.  Take a look at The Brokenwood Mysteries.  I love crime shows, British, Aussie, New Zealand.  (have you seen Top of the Lake? Yeow!)  This is Canadian and the over the top heartache damage in the lives of the heroes has it coming off as clumsy country western.
We weren't sure about Canadian police shows but the premise looked good. It met our expectations only each series had six. I'd recommend it.

I LOVE this show.  next to anne of avonley and anne of green gables, my, FAVORITE Canadian t.v. show/ series of all time.  the music is IMPOSSABLE to fine.  someone needs to compile a proper soundtrack.

Just plain corny--it's going to be hard to watch all the episodes because the writing is very poor.  I like the actors.  They do a good job with what they're given. Also, I expected this to be a BBC mystery, and it is American or Canadian.
I like the way that cracked stories are written
There are seven episodes in this set, six of which are from the first season. Only one, the seventh, is from Season 2. So if you have Season 1, you're paying for exactly one episode.
These episodes are part pf Season 1
The season prior was good; This season got excellent. Too bad they cancelled it. Takes place in modern day Toronto. BBC Canada did a very good job.
